subject: Programming
title: Testing Versus Verification
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Testing Versus Verification.

hook.text: The Ariane 5 software was tested thoroughly â€” for the Ariane 4. Nobody tested it for the new rocket.

buildup.text: Testing runs code with specific inputs. Formal verification proves code works for all inputs.

discovery.text: NASA uses formal methods for spacecraft. They mathematically prove critical code is correct.

twist.text: Verification is expensive and slow, so most companies skip it. They test and hope for the best.

climax.text: When lives depend on code, hoping is not a strategy. Proof beats probability.

punchline.text: Testing finds some bugs. Proof eliminates them.

quiz.question: How does formal verification differ from testing?
options: It proves code works for all inputs
